description: Latin, the lappet or flap of a garment.

entries.meaning: (botany) One of the narrow, jagged, irregular pieces or divisions which form a sort of fringe on the borders of the petals of some flowers.
(botany) A narrow, slender portion of the edge of a monophyllous calyx, or of any irregularly incised leaf.
(zoology) The posterior inner process of the stipes on the maxillae of insects.
